intro: Orchis crocea, commonly known as the early purple orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and a single spike of flowers. Its roots are tuberous, and it thrives in moist, calcareous soils in woodlands and meadows. Orchis crocea is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a symbol of fertility and prosperity.
